org.aludratest.invoker

Interface TestInvoker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AludraTestMethodInvoker, ErrorReportingInvoker

    public interface TestInvoker
    Abstraction of a test invoker. A test invoker is responsible to set up a test to execute with a given test context and to execute it.
    Author:
    Volker Bergmann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Class<?> getTestClass()
      Returns the class which contains the test for execution, if any.
      void invoke()
      Performs the test.
      void setContext(AludraTestContext context)
      Sets the test context to use for execution.

    • Method Detail

      • setContext

        void setContext(AludraTestContext context)
        Sets the test context to use for execution. The invoker is reponsible to provide it to the test to execute.
        Parameters:
        context - Test context to use for execution.

      • invoke

        void invoke()
     throws Throwable
        Performs the test.
        Throws:
        Throwable - if the invoked test raised a throwable

      • getTestClass

        Class<?> getTestClass()
        Returns the class which contains the test for execution, if any. This is for documentational purposes only, and null is permitted as return value if the test does not base on a class.
        Returns:
        The class which contains the test for execution, or null if no class information is available for this test.
